ratings.comment: Out of the three Bio 101 lecturers, Professor Sepaniac was by far the worst. She had never taught a class before and it showed. Her exam was incredibly difficult and as a first semester freshman, it was too much for me. She sped through her slides during lecture and its was incredibly hard to follow. Lots of pictures with very little description.

As everyone said she goes too fast in lectures but also doesn't see when people are asking questions. Material was too in-depth for an intro course and did not matter for any other material. She expects you to remember every slide and lecture. My notecard on the exam was filled to the brim with as much info as I could. Worst exam of the class.

This has to be the worst professor I've ever had. I will cut her some slack because she stated it was her first time teaching. However she was obviously not equipped to teach an introductory biology class. I would've failed if she was the teacher all year. Lecture slides had far too many words on them. She went through material way too fast.
Horrible professor. treats a 101 class like its a high level class and made the exam way too hard to the point where they had to curve it but none of the other professors. Not a fan of hers at all
She goes too fast and even while explaining doesn't really do a good job of explaining the concepts. Get lecture notes printed.

She definitely knows that she is talking about and does a good job of going in-depth with the information. A lot of people are saying she goes through lecture notes fast, which she does, but I printed out the notes before class and had no problems. So, if you type out the notes beforehand or print them out you should be fine!

She teaches lectures quite fast so be ready to write a lot or better print the lecture slides before class, I did that and I had no issues. Also, this was her first time teaching so I think she will find her pace by next semester. .  She knows a lot, a very smart and well-prepared professor.

She talks really fast, puts too much information on her slides, the font is small so you can't really read unless upfront, almost didn't give out practice questions for her exam. The class has three professors, she's the second one, starts after exam 2. Doesn't stop too often if there are questions. This class is mandatory for most majors, beware.
